Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay- BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Romero M
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled here in October2011 and stayed at this dump for 2 nights. First stair way up to our room smelled like a urinal. The first night there was a nail sticking out the floor in front of bathroom door called front desk and was told theyd check on in the morning just dont step on it. Floor was stained badly. Top it off came home with BED BUGS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not bad!!”
Reviews.Author: dhar_sneha
Reviews.Content: Since i was not willing to spend a lot of money on the stay n rather save that for the shopping. I found this hotel quite decent. Thought the bathrooms had a severe clogging problem but they were nice enough to shift us to a new room. The hospitality was very nice. I was not carrying an extension for my laptop charger but the Receptionist got it done somehow and helped me with the same. The breakfast is not too good, the bagels r pretty hard n overall they don't provide you any choices but the kitchen amenities are open for use at any time of the day or night which includes the oven, cutlery, etc. The beds n bedding is clean and cosy (:

Reviews.Title: “Left after 15 minutes in the place!”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin B
Reviews.Content: We initially checked in, and I figured that it was just an older looking Day's Inn. They had a sign behind the counter that said "No refunds after 10 minutes." I guess that should have tipped me off. When I entered the room, I initially thought to check the dresser for cockroaches. I didn't find any, but the room was filthy. I don't think the sheets had been washed. There was hair and possible mice droppings on the sink, and the smoke alarm was gone, leaving only wires exposed. I have a 6 month old, and there was no way my wife and I were going to stay. We quickly loaded up out things. I went to the desk, and the man there said that "Room 102 is a good room." No refund was given. La Quinta across the highway is 100% better.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: spaceheartl4
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel, even without the bedbugs. Stopped here after seeing a billboard on I-70 for $29. When we arrived the price was $49. Even the clerk seemed apologetic at the misinformation. The room was dingy and in need of upgrades. The light from the hall shown in through the curtains so the room was never dark. I woke up in the middle of the night realizing I hadn't checked for bedbugs. Big Mistake. They were all over my pillow and sheets. Three days later I have over 2 dozen bites all over my body. When we went downstairs the night clerk said he didn't have the ability to give us a refund but the manager would be in by 8/9. He gave us another room to shower and let us use the hotel facilities to wash our clothes. The new room also had bedbugs. By the time we washed all our clothes and checked our luggage, it was 8:30 and the day clerk had arrived (who spoke very poor English), but no manager. We were finally told he wasn't getting in until 11. We needed to get on the road so we tried calling him and leaving a message, but we were never even told the manager's name. Based on previous reviews, I don't have much hope of resolving this simply. In all this time I noticed that the continental breakfast was not restocked once in the 3 hours it was supposed to be available, with only one slice of bread available as early as 6:30 (breakfast was from 6-9), even though I saw granola bars, etc in the back while we did our laundry. Save yourself the hassle and drive to the next stop.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: djdrake12
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are very nice, but the rooms are horrible. They are very dirty and the funiture was falling apart. I would never stay here again and I would not suggest you stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Appauling!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: angry12
Reviews.Content: Even the gas station attendant told us we should keep driving but we had already paid for the rooms. This isn't even you get what you paid for. My boyfriend is in the operators union and they stay at the cheapest hotels as possible and they are in better condition and cleaner. I will never stay or recommend this hotel ever again. Don't put yourself through this.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: MariaSilvestri
Reviews.Content: We just happened to this place off of I-70 late at night looking for a place to stay. I wish we hadn't stopped here. Outdoor corridors have a distinctly unsafe feeling, and while the room was generally clean, it was horribly outdated and in severe need of updating (starting over from scratch would be a better option). I realized before I even walked in that this wasn't going to be such a great place, because the man behind the desk was looking at me through a window... Then I turned around to see the breakfast offerings, there was no way we were going to be taking advantage of that! There are other budget hotels closeby, choose one of them instead!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here! These people are crooks!”
Reviews.Author: Stella78
Reviews.Content: My husband had booked the hotel for the weekend of the Indianapolis 500. He booked through their web-site which is typically a little more friendly and because he stayed a few months prior for business and had an alright experience for the price. Our situation changed and we had to bring our dog with us so we had to cancel our reservation two days prior to checking in. Two days prior during a busy Memorial day weekend. Typically Day's Inn takes dogs but this one doesn't. After a day wasted on the phone with a horrible receptionist who refused to put us through to a manager and a manager, Andy, who refused to call us even though we requested several times, we are still being told that the charges won't be dropped. My husband explained that unfortunately the situation changed which isn't typical and a two day notice should be sufficient as it is with most hotels. And by the way, we never even received a confirmation number or e-mail which is also very suspicious. He's had to call corporate, has been tossed back and forth, and has been nothing but professional, but they are now saying they will charge our card for all four days when originally we were told we would be charged for one. Finally we called Day's Inn customer service headquarters and spoke with John and were told that because we had a contract we are not going to be let out of it and therefore does not indicate poor customer service, that the original quote of being charged only for one day was the hotel mispeaking, and that he has no problems with it reflecting poorly on Day's Inn. Now, you would think in order to keep a customer for the future they would be willing to extend some good customer service but this hotel, the manager Andy, and Day's Inn customer service must have a bad track record and must really fear the empty room so they are trying to get money any way they can-by taking it from people who aren't even using their service. How this is different from theft I do not know. Unfortunately for all Day's Inn we will never stay at one again. We go to Indianapolis often for business and they have lost us as future customers. In a service industry, which my husband and I are both in, there should be some flexibility for the customer if you want them to return and spread the good word about their business. But I guess to Day's Inn policy is more important than people and service. I cannot urge people strongly enough to stay far away from this place. We stay at a lot of hotels throughout the year and this is by far the worst we have ever been treated. I have never heard of a manager who refuses to call customers to smooth over an issue or a customer service representative who is okay with ripping people off to the tune of $500. We are contacting the Better Business Bureau on this place as well as our credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing has changed”
Reviews.Author: Terv
Reviews.Content: Based on ALL the past reviews, NOTHING has changed! It may be a cheap room but you are getting a hazardous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: ktowntravllr
Reviews.Content: We were exhausted after a long day of driving and saw this place after the first hotel we planned to stay in around the corner didn't work out (the Super 8 is even worse). Very cheap with one of the coupons from the welcome centre, but not worth it. The list of problems goes on and on. 1. the bathtub was broken on the bottom, and looked like it had been patched with something. the patch wasn't solid, so we could not shower as it looked like it wasn't at all hygenic, and bacteria etc. were likely present in the crack 2. there was mucous from someones nose on the wall near the sink 3. the toilet had dried feces on the inside of the bowl, so it was apparent that it had not been cleaned. There was also what appeared to be feces smears on the wall beside the toilet. 4. the air conditioner in the room was not working enough to actually cool the room off. it was so hot and stuffy in the morning that we just opened the door to get some air once we were dressed. We didn't feel well we were so hot and the air was so stale in the room. 5. the free daybreak breakfast had no fresh fruit (as guaranteed by the president on the web page), to make tea we had to heat water in a dirty microwave in styrofoam cups (health practitioners tell you not to heat things in styrofoam), the pastries consisted of a few pre-packaged sugar donuts. we chose to eat our breakfast elsewhere. 6. when I informed the front desk of our complaints he wrote some of them down, and then just stood and looked at me. no other comments or apologies were made. I emailed a compaint to days inn when I got home, and was told to wait and the hotel would contact me directly to resolve the situation. When I didn't hear from the hotel, I contacted the phone number they gave me in the email, and was told they would mail me a cheque for half of the cost of the nights stay. The room wasn't even worth half what I paid for it however. This is the second time I've had a problem with a days inn that I've directed to customer service. The first time a hotel charged me twice for the same night. It took several months of dealing with the hotel directly to get them to reverse the charge. The days inn head office would not help me because the hotels are all independently owned and operated. I've had enough of this chain, and will never stay at one again. If I pull into a chain hotels parking lot I expect a basic level of service and cleanliness. Days Inn has demonstrated that this is not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in America!”
Reviews.Author: BEEBQ
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel in 15 years of staying in 100 plus hotels a year. Where do I start-filth everywhere, towels filthy, a tub that was horrendous, curtains broken, lights broken, door handle broke, security peep hole broken. I'd sleep in my vehicle before staying there again. This hotel should be condemmed. Days Inn has no standards anymore.

Reviews.Title: “The dirtiest hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: kisstherain9118
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've ever been too. The floor looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in years. There was garbage all over the floor, behind the dresser and even under the bed. To make it even worse there was a PILL on the floor what if there were children!! the sheets were ripped and the bathroom was filthy. There was hair in the bathroom and the toilet looked like it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. The breakfast was just cereal nothing special. Definitely not worth the money. The man at the counter when we called to complain was not nice at all answered with ya, hu-uh. I've stayed in cheaper hotels that were actually clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were traveling across the country and stayed at a days inn, because the book said the hotel awas 4 sunbursts. After driving for 10 hours the hotel looked ok on the outside but the inside of the room was well below the standard i expected for a 4 sunburst hotel. The lights were not all working and the walls were in need of repair as well as the carpeting. there was entirlely too much furniture in the room and I had to climb over the table and chairs to turn on the airconditioning. They say they have internet servicellll could not find it. Although the area has restaurnats the security was lacking around the hotel. We had a bad stay there and the managenment who were very unavailable for days offered no remorse or compensation. Cant recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly, depressing, expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business. While the new manager who was working the front desk seemed very on the ball, when I got to my room, it was so ugly, dark, smelly, depressing...ugh! Nothing on the walls, everything looked musty. There weren't many hotel rooms available the day I went, and I had to choose between a $60 hotel & the days inn--for $180. I assumed the $180 would be nicer! I wouldn't have paid more than $40 for that room. But I had to leave for my meeting, and did not complain right then. I decided to fly home earlier, and not stay at the hotel, and when I called to check out, the receptionist was so rude. Yuck! Calls to the Days Inn HQ only got me a free stay at the same crappy place. And they charged me! Blech! Don't stay there!
